conclusion: Analyze the path of the light beam through the prism using principles of reflection and refraction.
Identify angles in the prism: Given angles A = 90°, B = 60°, therefore angle C = 30°.
The light beam starts from point D on side BC, reflects off point E on side AC, undergoes total internal reflection at point F on side AB, and exits the prism.
Use the law of reflection at point E: angle of incidence equals angle of reflection, both are θi.
For total internal reflection at F, the angle of incidence must be greater than the critical angle.
Critical angle θc is given by sin θc = 1/n, where n is the refractive index.
Angle of deviation δ is the angle between the incident ray and the emergent ray; emergent ray is parallel to incident ray.
Calculate angle of deviation δ = 180° - 2θi; since total internal reflection occurs, θi is the critical angle θc.
Assume refractive index n of the prism material is known.
Substitute θc into deviation formula: δ = 180° - 2θc.
Angle of deviation δ depends on critical angle θc, which depends on refractive index n.
